definition: in time with (i.e. same rhythm)/to keep in step with/fig. to cooperate
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]
variant of 合[he2]
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)

sentences.english: Listed with rich color and fashion color trend just beat.
sentences.chinese: 上市颜色丰富多彩与流行色潮流正好合拍。

sentences.english: Babies and the chancy life of a musician do not exactly go together.
sentences.chinese: 生儿育女和乐师动荡不定的生活是不合拍的。

sentences.english: The past co-productions are mostly Hongkong investment company, issued in the mainland.
sentences.chinese: 过去合拍片大部分都是香港公司投资，在内地发行。

sentences.english: You are quite likely to agree on most subjects.
sentences.chinese: 你们在大多数问题上非常合拍。

sentences.english: Cartoons co-produced by domestic and foreign producers will have to get approval first.
sentences.chinese: 中外合拍动画片在这一时段播出，需报广电总局批准。

sentences.english: I always say co-productions can be out living space.
sentences.chinese: 我一直说合拍片可以算是港片生存的空间。

sentences.english: To welcome the steamer, a long line of honor guards marched all in step.
sentences.chinese: 为了欢迎轮船的到来，一支仪仗队步调合拍的行进着。

sentences.english: He was ­intuitive and especially attuned to the love of his life.
sentences.chinese: 他这人是直觉的，特别为了与生命中的爱人合拍时。

sentences.english: The concept of kindness should resonate with your spiritual beliefs.
sentences.chinese: 善意的概念与你的精神信仰应该是合拍的。

talented man and beautiful woman/ideal couple

sweethearts/lovers

unwell/indisposed/out of sorts/euphemism or honorific for ill
